citation.article-title: Pseudoalteromonas arctica sp. nov., an aerobic, psychrotolerant, marine bacterium isolated from Spitzbergen.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pseudoalteromonas arctica sp. nov.
Pseudoalteromonas arctica (arc′ti.ca. L. fem. adj. arctica from the Arctic, referring to the site where the type strain was isolated).
Cells are straight, polar-flagellated, Gram-negative and rod-shaped, 0.15–0.2 μm wide and 0.4–0.7 μm long.
They occur singly and are non-spore-forming and strictly aerobic.
Colonies on agar medium are slightly orange, circular, smooth and convex.
Temperature range for growth is 4–25 °C, with an optimum between 10 and 15 °C.
pH range for growth is 6–8, with an optimum at pH 7–8.
Growth is observed at 0–9 % NaCl (w/v), with an optimum between 2 and 3 % (w/v).

Growth is observed with α-cyclodextrin, dextrin, cellobiose, d-galactose, α-d-glucose, maltose, d-mannitol, melibiose, sucrose, pyruvic acid methyl ester, d-gluconic acid, l-alanine, l-alanylglycine, glycyl-l-glutamic acid, l-serine, aesculin, ferric citrate and capric acid.
Positive for activities of the following enzymes: pullulanase, protease, β-glucanase, esterase, pectinase, β-glucosidase and β-galactosidase.
FAMEs comprise 20.3 % straight-chain saturated FAMEs, 20.2 % terminally branched saturated FAMEs and 56.1 % monounsaturated FAMEs.

Phylogenetic analysis reveals a close relationship to P. elyakovii, P. distincta and P. nigrifaciens with 99 % 16S rRNA gene sequence similarity and 47.6, 44.2 and 22.6 % DNA–DNA relatedness, respectively.
The type strain is A 37-1-2T (=LMG 23753T=DSM 18437T), isolated from seawater samples taken from Spitzbergen.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 39 mol%.
